entry.def: To bamboozle someone means to confuse them greatly and often trick them.

example.ex: He was bamboozled by con men.

means.word_mean: 1. conceal one's true motives from especially by elaborately feigning good intentions so as to gain an end;

sentences.sentence: "He bamboozled his professors into thinking that he knew the subject well"

auth_sentence.content: They tried to bamboozle the Wall Street analytical community into believing that it would fly anyway.
auth_sentence.res_content: They tried to bamboozle the Wall Street analytical community into believing that it would fly anyway.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: They tried to bamboozle the Wall Street analytical community into believing that it would fly anyway.

auth_sentence.content: Perry is not the first GOP candidate to attempt to bamboozle his audience with such nonsense.
auth_sentence.res_content: Perry is not the first GOP candidate to attempt to bamboozle his audience with such nonsense.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Perry is not the first GOP candidate to attempt to bamboozle his audience with such nonsense.

sentences.en: She bamboozled Grandfather into marrying her.
sentences.cn: 她把爷爷哄骗得(答应)把她嫁出去。

sentences.en: He was bamboozled into joining the club.
sentences.cn: 他是被哄骗来参加俱乐部的。

sentences.en: He bamboozled the old lady out of her diamond ring.
sentences.cn: 他骗了那老妇人的钻石戒指。

sentences.en: He bamboozled his professors into thinking that he knew the subject well.
sentences.cn: 他欺骗了他的教授，使教授认为他很了解这门学科。
